snippet: The bay is normally lit up by microscopic plankton — an important tourist attraction — but in January it abruptly lost its glow, alarming scientists.
abstract: Mosquito Bay on island of Vieques, Puerto Rico, is normally lit up by microscopic plankton, an important tourist attraction, but bay abruptly lost its glow in January and has brightened only somewhat in recent weeks; blackout has alarmed government officials, scientists and residents, who depend on tourism to fuel a lackluster economy, but cause remains a mystery.
lead_paragraph: The bay is normally lit up by microscopic plankton — an important tourist attraction — but in January it abruptly lost its glow, alarming scientists.

headline.main: Puerto Rico Debates Who Put Out the Lights in Mosquito Bay
headline.print_headline: Puerto Rico Debates Who Put Out the Lights in a Bay
